text: What is a liquidity pool in trading?
answers: An area on the chart where many orders are resting

text: What typically happens after a major liquidity sweep?
answers: The market often reverses once stop orders are collected

text: When price is trading below VWAP with increasing sell volume, what bias is implied?

answers: Possible imbalance between aggressive buyers and sellers

text: In trading psychology, what is the most common cause of revenge trading?
answers: Following a trading journal too strictly
Trying to immediately recover losses emotionally

text: What does an increase in Open Interest during a rapid price up-move typically indicate?
What is a fair value gap (FVG)?
answers: A gap visible only on daily charts
A price imbalance where no trading occurred between orders
A gap between weekend candles in crypto
A special zone created by bots

text: What does a trendline break with strong volume usually suggest?
What is the purpose of journaling trades?
answers: To track performance and identify behavior patterns

text: What is a Point of Control shift in Volume Profile?
answers: When POC moves to a new price level indicating changing value

text: What does imbalance in orderflow indicate?
answers: A misprint on the exchange feed

text: Which statement best describes a breakout failure?
answers: Price breaks a level and quickly returns back below or above it
Price breaks a level and accelerates

text: What is the Fear & Greed Index used for?
What does a high volume node represent?
answers: Area of high participation and acceptance
A spot where price must reverse

text: What typically causes wicks on candlestick charts?
answers: Temporary price rejection caused by aggressive order reactions
